rationales.self_direction: Chose her own research approach over supervisor's quantitative methods: 'Dr. Khalil wants regression models... What I have is Abu Mahmoud saying we wrote letters until we ran out of paper.'
rationales.power: Explicitly left a position of authority in engineering because she was 'working for someone else's priorities' - surrendered status to pursue values.
rationales.universalism: Entire entry demonstrates concern for displaced farmers and social justice: 'This is what I came here for. Not the degree, not the credentials.'

rationales.self_direction: Refuses to follow supervisor's methodology despite pressure: 'every time I sit down to write the chapter his way, my hands just stop. Something in me refuses.'
rationales.conformity: Deliberately not conforming like younger students: 'The younger students in my cohort, they nod along, they revise when told to revise. Maybe that is smarter.'
rationales.universalism: Insists on treating farmers with dignity rather than as data: 'Reducing it to a variable in a regression feels like betraying that trust.'

rationales.self_direction: Building intellectual foundation for her own approach: 'If Dr. Khalil will not accept my approach, maybe I can build enough of a foundation that he cannot dismiss it as naive.'
rationales.achievement: Demonstrates persistence and hard work toward goal - studying in her car by phone light until late despite obstacles with roommates.

rationales.self_direction: Successfully defended her autonomous methodology: 'Walked out of that room feeling like I had earned something that was mine.'
rationales.achievement: Demonstrated competence to committee, earned recognition and approval for her unconventional framework.
